programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Poitevin Marshes, the children of the marshland The Regional Natural Park of the Marais Poitevin stretches over three departments: the Vendée, Charente-Maritime and Deux-Sèvres. Sixty kilometres long by thirty kilometres wide, it is the largest wetland in France, after the Camargue. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays Bigouden
In the Pays Bigouden, Brittany, Lenny and Lucie present all the stages involved in their seaweed production, from collection to sale. Sara explains the phases in brewing beer, from hops to tasting. To end, we meet some of the bird-lovers helping birds to nest.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: America in Montbéliard! Montbéliard and the USA are two different lands yet closely links by the Franche-Comté origins of those who helped build America. In this special feature on the US in Montbéliard, the programme brings a touch of the New World to Doubs! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The roadside diners of the Lower St Lawrence
In the Lower St Lawrence region, two roadside diners offer a menu where seafood takes centre stage. Who could resist a visit! We also discover peameal bacon, Charlotte's market and join tourists on the trail of good food in Montreal and Ottawa...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: La Courtauld Gallery, Londres La Courtauld Gallery est un musée d'art situé dans le Somerset House, sur le Strand, dans le centre de Londres. Grand collectionneur, visionnaire audacieux, l'industriel Samuel Courtauld a su choisir et promouvoir des artistes, jusque-là refusés par les grandes institutions, dont certains peintres impressionnistes, fauvistes ou cubistes. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Haute-Savoie, from Aix-les-Bains to the Haute-Maurienne A journey through a land of mountain folk and a thousand treasures. The enchanting natural setting of Lake Bourget, the Belle Époque charm of Aix-les-Bains where the crowned heads of Europe once came to take the waters, the jewels of the Beaufortain hidden deep in the Doron Valley... Directed by: Charles Bourla (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Périgord, generous by nature The Dordogne, reputed for its scenery and its heritage. From the attractive city of Bergerac to Monbazillac, the Proumeyssac Chasm and the river meanders of Limeuil and Trémolat, there's no shortage of gems to discover! Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Espinouse Massif
In the Espinouse Massif, we meet Lilian and his swarm of bees. At the Les Taillades Farm, Aline and Guillaume have plenty to keep them busy, between caring for the animals and maturing the cheeses. All you need to know about the Pardailhan turnip; exploring the Hérépian Bell Museum.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Who understands Burgundian? Sandwiched between Paris and Lyon and spanning Burgundy's four départements, the Morvan area has own unique characteristics and customs. Can someone from Belfort, Jura or even Dijon understand the Burgundian language? Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Hydration and dehydration
How can you tell if you are drinking enough? Also on the programme: Les Herbes Salées du Bas-Saint-Laurent; haggis, the famous dish from Scotland; and black garlic from L'Île d'Orléans...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde

programme.desc: The Haute-Savoie, from Aix-les-Bains to the Haute-Maurienne A journey through a land of mountain folk and a thousand treasures. The enchanting natural setting of Lake Bourget, the Belle Époque charm of Aix-les-Bains where the crowned heads of Europe once came to take the waters, the jewels of the Beaufortain hidden deep in the Doron Valley... Directed by: Charles Bourla (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Périgord, generous by nature The Dordogne, reputed for its scenery and its heritage. From the attractive city of Bergerac to Monbazillac, the Proumeyssac Chasm and the river meanders of Limeuil and Trémolat, there's no shortage of gems to discover! Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
They're the future of fashion: discover the fashion show for students of the Institut Français de la Mode. Learn all about the padded jacket. Interview with Valentine H Despointes, a leatherwork artist. Wearing the colour brown. The architect Régis Botta presents one of his projects: a bright, simple duplex.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Michel Roth
He is one of France's most highly-qualified chefs. Michel Roth is back in Marseille, where he spent his childhood and learned his trade. An opportunity for the Lorraine-born chef to immerse himself in the land he loves, surrounded by family and friends: where good food is served with emotion.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as an outdoor adventure guide On the banks of Cambell River, Julien meets up with Bastian. Former banker turned helicopter pilot, he left Switzerland to start again from nothing. He takes Julien off to explore the endless playground that surrounds him, by boat, campervan and air. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Apprendre le français grâce à l'Épicerie
programme.desc:
Learning French thanks to l'Épicerie
There's no shortage of viewers who have learnt French thanks to the programme. We share their stories! We also discover a café inspired by Scandinavia, a pupil- teacher reunion, tropical-style fried chicken and a surprise tribute to Denis Gagné for his final programme!
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Les Huguenots Raoul and Valentine: the story of impossible love set against the Saint Bartholomew's Day massacre... "Les Huguenots", a masterpiece by Giacomo Meyerbeer, to a libretto by Eugène Scribe and Émile Deschamps, was created in 1836 and an immediate success, carried by the greatest singers of the time. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Aveyron, from Aubrac to Larzac A department steeped in authenticity and fascinating contrasts, the Aveyron takes its name from the river that crosses it. Wide open spaces, magnificent gorges, geological treasures, villages brimming with charm, churches, castles built by the Knights Templar: what tourist could resist the Aveyron, its unique heritage and innumerable natural treasures? Directed by: François Chayé (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Périgord, generous by nature The Dordogne, reputed for its scenery and its heritage. From the attractive city of Bergerac to Monbazillac, the Proumeyssac Chasm and the river meanders of Limeuil and Trémolat, there's no shortage of gems to discover! Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Homemade corn tortillas
For an easy-to-prepare way to serve prawn tacos and a mango salsa, Ricardo cooks his own home-made corn tortillas for a flavour that's even more authentic.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Jouy-en-Josas, to visit the Toile de Jouy museum. The Argentinean chef Juan Arbelaez invites us into his kitchen, filled with a thousand and one flavours. Schiaparelli, the perfect combination of art and fashion through collections inspired by surrealism. The restorer Isabelle Pitre offers paintings and artworks all their original beauty. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.desc: Fried chicken and waffles Bob le Chef goes for a buttermilk-based cuisine with his two recipes today: fried chicken and waffles. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Éva and Alex, Montérégie (West Bolton) The birth of Éva and Alex's baby led them to leave their shared rental in the Rosemont district of Montreal for a house in Montérégie. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The roadside diners of the Lower St Lawrence
In the Lower St Lawrence region, two roadside diners offer a menu where seafood takes centre stage. Who could resist a visit! We also discover peameal bacon, Charlotte's market and join tourists on the trail of good food in Montreal and Ottawa...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Centre J. Paul Getty, Los Angeles Avec ses allures de « village italien dans les collines », le Getty Center comprend des expositions de sculpture et d'art classique, de peintures européennes, de dessins, manuscrits, arts décoratifs et de photographies. Sa collection de chefs-d'oeuvre de grands peintres français, du Valentin à Moreau, tient une place d'honneur. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Vendée, from Les Sables-d'Olonne to the Marais Poitevin Its endless sandy beaches put the Vendée amongst the French holidaymakers' favourite summer destinations. A paradise for tourists, from exploring the Marais Poitevin marshes aboard a flat-bottomed boat, to taking the ferry to the island of Noirmoutier before continuing the visit in Les Sables-d'Olonne, Fontenay-le-Comte, Vouvant, Mortagne-sur-Sèvre and Les Herbiers. Directed by: Mélodie Proust (season 3, France, 2016)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: The Périgord, generous by nature The Dordogne, reputed for its scenery and its heritage. From the attractive city of Bergerac to Monbazillac, the Proumeyssac Chasm and the river meanders of Limeuil and Trémolat, there's no shortage of gems to discover! Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Picton, Ontario
Louis goes to Picton, in Ontario, to meet a client who is battling with a squirrel problem.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Breakfast for the "morning people" The chef Jean-Luc Boulay, from the restaurant Saint-Amour in Québec, offers the morning presenters, Patrick Masbourian, Ève-Marie Lortie and Kim Rusk, a real treat by preparing a meal that they had almost forgotten: breakfast. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Yoghurt
Today you can easily find over 200 varieties of yoghurt on sale. We take a look at what's available and market trends for the future. Plus: testing kitchen whisks, three techniques for making meringue and an interview with the Anishinaabe chef Gerry Brandon.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Myriam Fehmiu.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Musée de la Legion of Honor, San Francisco Le Legion of Honor de San Francisco est un musée d'art américain construit en 1924. Il rend hommage aux soldats Californiens morts en France pendant la Première Guerre mondiale et donne aux peintres, tels Claude Lorrain, La Tour, Le Sueur, Watteau, Boucher, Fragonard, Vigée Le Brun, une place de choix... Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)
